title: Manufacturing Engineer Operations Manufacturing Center
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before.â€¯By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more thanâ€¯ 800 people who are â€¯as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. The role: 
Are you ready to be at the forefront of revolutionizing air mobility? As we embark on the exciting journey towards serial production of our groundbreaking Lilium jet, we are seeking an ambitious and skilled Manufacturing Engineer to join our world-class manufacturing center.
Reporting to the Manufacturing Engineering Manager Operations, you will work together on the design, development, and execution of our data management and operational software operations. Your focus is on the detailed interactions of the IT solutions that define our manufacturing environment, including PLM, MPP, ERP, MES, and big data analytics. With these tools, you create and maintain detailed work plans to include EBOM, MBOM, routing, tooling, PPE, etc.
You will work proactively with cross-functional teams including design, production, planning, quality, procurement, and logistics.
Your Day to Day:
Proactively drive the delivery of production orders in the manufacturing center on time, on cost, and on quality
Provide daily shop floor support and act as the first point of contact for machine operator questions
Respond to and drive resolution of ANDONs and non-conformities
Plan the shop floor work schedule together with the production teams and PP&C
Create and maintain comprehensive work plans containing work instructions and time data
Determine the necessary production capacities in response to process and design changes, ensuring optimal resource utilization
Champion the optimization of manufacturing processes through continuous improvement initiatives, utilizing data-driven insights and industry best practices
Develop a lean process flow across our production line to ensure that product, process, and factory design work together as a stable production system
Proactively initiate change requests to the design team, facilitating the achievement of high-rate and cost-effective manufacturing goals
Develop and implement robust manufacturing strategies, considering technological advancements and industry trends to enhance overall efficiency.
About you:
We are looking for a passionate team player who loves to collaborate to get things done with urgency in a fast-paced and changing work environment. Bringing proven analytical capabilities, youâ€™ll be a strong written and verbal communicator who loves to solve problems. You have an entrepreneurial mindset and you strive to build an excellent organisation, culture, and company.
Interacting daily with a variety of technical audiences, you will be comfortable working in cross-functional teams, developing and nurturing excellent relationships.
You have demonstrated impact in design for manufacturing activities and will show an overall Lean awareness with an eye for simplification, continuous improvement, and consciousness of health & safety factors.
Key requirements:   
Industrial, Electrical or Mechanical Engineering degree
Minimum of 3 years of work experience in manufacturing operations in the field of CNC machining, additive manufacturing (3D Printing) and metrology
English CEFR level B2 or higher
Proficiency in reading technical drawings and specifications
Expert in writing concise technical instructions
Six Sigma certification desired
Experience in aviation start-up companies desired
CAD know-how desired
Practical experience with PPAP / APQP process desired
 
#LI-CG1Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
